instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Board had minor corrosion around L9580 <CAPACITOR>C9586</CAPACITOR> was shorted, removed it and short is gone but now it is stuck at 20v 0.05a, tried flashing/reviving T2 but comes up with errors all the time.

Checked all power FETs and they are all fine.

PPBUS 12.6V
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> 2.5v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_G3S</SIGNAL> present
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> present
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_T</SIGNAL> present
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Board doesn't try to start at all?
Did you test in SMC bypass mode?
Check if all SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages are present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
I measured the missing rails while I connected the charger and they don't even pulse once, the meter shows 5V, then 20V at 0.15a then goes down to 20V 0.08a then 0.05a and stays there.

SMC bypass was tried but same result. 

SLPS2R and AWAKE signals present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Be sure to use the second machine with the same macOS as in the T2 machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
This amigo is a great tip, I have not tried that and the customer just told me he has Big Sur and I was trying the T2 firmware with a Catalina Machine.

Question for future reference, will it work if say I have Big Sur on the working machine and Catalina on the non working one?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Must be the same macOS on both machines.
Try all options.
Someone in the forum mentioned a Mac Mini from 2020 which came with Mojave!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
I will have to send [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] a present with Santa this Christmas, thanks for helping, I installed Big Sur on another USB-C mac and restored T2 firmware, Mac is now back to life.

Thanks and happy holidays!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.05a
threads.message: You're welcome, glad to hear is solved.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Just for feedback, today I got another 2018 stuck at 5v after checking the board for problems found nothing wrong and decided to restore T2, I did it from the Big Sur machine and it failed, then I did it from another Mac with USB-C and Catalina and it worked, so when restoring T2 firmware make sure the OS matches that of the faulty Mac.
